column1: These create the power needed to push off with the foot or go up on the toes.
Tendinitis due to overuse is most common in younger people.
Tendinitis from arthritis is more common in middle-aged and older adults.
A bone spur or growth may form in the back of the heel bone.
Flat feet will put more tension on the tendon.
They will look for tenderness along the tendon and pain in the area of the tendon when you stand on your toes.
An MRI scan may be done if you are considering surgery or there is a chance that you have a tear in the Achilles tendon.
Changes in activity may help manage the symptoms: - Decrease or stop any activity that causes pain.
- Switch to biking, swimming, or other activities that put less stress on the Achilles tendon.
If these treatments do not improve symptoms, you may need surgery to remove inflamed tissue and abnormal areas of the tendon.
Keep in mind that symptoms may return if you do not limit activities that cause pain, or if you do not maintain the strength and flexibility of the tendon.
Call your health care provider if: - You have pain in the heel around the Achilles tendon that is worse with activity.
